page.title: 13THE SPORT'S CENTRE, CORBY.
page.content: The Sport's Centre adjoining the school was built in 1974 to serve school and community. Jointly funded by Corby District Council and the County Council, the large main hall is used by the school and partitioned off by adults for day use. All is available for the public after 6pm. It offers 4 badminton courts, and facilities for indoor hockey, roller hockey, netball, basketball, volleyball, tennis and 5-a- side football, Karate, judo, keep-fit, trampolining, gymnastics, table tennis, indoor bowls, archery and cricket are on offer. A 'weights' room with adjacent sauna, solarium and changing facilities complete the suite. Upstairs are social facilities: lounge bar for public use, committee room, cafe used by a play group and OAP's club, all open to the public seven days a week.
